intro: Auxopus kamerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon star grass, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon and neighboring regions of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the grass family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
